metadata.title: Complete Studio Ghibli Database
metadata.description: Comprehensive collection of Studio Ghibli films, characters, themes, and cultural context
metadata.focus: Accessibility, cultural context, therapeutic value, and detailed analysis

films.title: Spirited Away
films.plot_summary: Ten-year-old Chihiro becomes trapped in a spirit world and must work at a bathhouse to save her parents, who have been turned into pigs.
films.cultural_significance: Highest-grossing film in Japanese history, Academy Award winner, explores Japanese folklore and environmental themes.

chihiro.name: Chihiro Ogino/Sen
chihiro.character_arc: Transforms from sullen, fearful child to brave, compassionate young person
chihiro.neurodivergent_representation: Shows growth in confidence and social skills, relatable for anxious children

haku.name: Haku/Kohaku River
haku.significance: Represents connection to nature and lost memories

no_face.name: No-Face/Kaonashi
no_face.character_development: From destructive force to helpful companion through kindness

environmental_themes.pollution: Stink spirit reveals industrial pollution of rivers
environmental_themes.development: Loss of natural spaces to urban development
environmental_themes.spirits: Nature spirits displaced by human activity

therapeutic_value.anxiety: Shows overcoming fear through courage and kindness
therapeutic_value.depression: Themes of finding purpose and connection
therapeutic_value.adhd: Visual stimulation, adventure narrative maintains attention

cultural_context.folklore: Based on Japanese kami (spirits) and yokai traditions
cultural_context.food: Importance of food in Japanese culture and hospitality

accessibility_notes.visual: Rich visual storytelling, minimal dialogue sections
accessibility_notes.cognitive: Complex plot may need discussion, clear moral themes

quotes: Once you've met someone, you never really forget them. It just takes a while for your memories to return.
I finally get a bouquet and it's a goodbye present. That's depressing.

films.title: My Neighbor Totoro
films.plot_summary: Two young sisters discover magical forest spirits while their mother recovers from illness in the countryside.
films.cultural_significance: Totoro became Studio Ghibli's mascot, beloved family film exploring childhood and family bonds.

satsuki.name: Satsuki Kusakabe
satsuki.character_traits: Protective, mature for her age, maintains optimism

mei.name: Mei Kusakabe
mei.neurodivergent_friendly: Impulsive behavior and curiosity relatable for ADHD children

totoro.name: Totoro
totoro.symbolism: Childhood wonder, connection to nature, comfort
totoro.therapeutic_role: Provides comfort and magic during difficult times

family_dynamics.sibling_relationship: Realistic sibling dynamics and mutual support

therapeutic_value.anxiety: Comforting presence of Totoro, family support
therapeutic_value.autism: Sensory-rich forest scenes, clear family relationships
therapeutic_value.adhd: Mei's impulsive behavior normalized, adventure elements

nature_themes.seasons: Connection to natural cycles and growth

films.title: Princess Mononoke
films.plot_summary: Ashitaka becomes involved in a struggle between forest gods and humans consuming the forest's resources.
films.cultural_significance: Complex exploration of environmental destruction and the cost of progress.

san.name: San (Princess Mononoke)
san.symbolism: Wild nature, rejection of human society

lady_eboshi.name: Lady Eboshi
lady_eboshi.complexity: Neither pure villain nor hero, represents progress and destruction

environmental_message.balance: Need for harmony between humans and nature

mature_themes.violence: More intense than typical Ghibli films

therapeutic_value.anger_management: Explores consequences of hatred and anger
therapeutic_value.autism: Complex moral themes may need discussion
therapeutic_value.adhd: Action sequences maintain attention, longer runtime

accessibility_notes.age_recommendation: Better for older children and teens

films.title: Howl's Moving Castle
films.plot_summary: Sophie is cursed with old age and seeks help from the wizard Howl, discovering inner strength and true beauty.
films.cultural_significance: Anti-war message combined with themes of self-acceptance and inner beauty.

sophie.name: Sophie Hatter
sophie.character_arc: From self-doubting young woman to confident, powerful individual
sophie.aging_curse: Physical transformation leads to emotional liberation
sophie.neurodivergent_themes: Self-doubt and social anxiety overcome through adventure

howl.name: Howl Jenkins Pendragon
howl.neurodivergent_representation: Emotional volatility, perfectionism, anxiety about appearance

calcifer.name: Calcifer
calcifer.role: Fire demon, comic relief and wisdom

self_acceptance_themes.confidence: Inner strength more important than appearance

war_themes.anti_war_message: War shown as destructive and pointless
war_themes.civilian_impact: Focus on how war affects ordinary people
war_themes.transformation: War literally transforms people into monsters

therapeutic_value.anxiety: Howl's dramatic reactions normalize emotional intensity
therapeutic_value.depression: Sophie's transformation shows potential for change
therapeutic_value.autism: Detailed magical systems, clear character development

accessibility_notes.positive_messages: Strong themes of self-acceptance and love

films.title: Kiki's Delivery Service
films.plot_summary: Young witch Kiki starts a delivery service in a new town, facing challenges of independence and loss of magical powers.
films.cultural_significance: Coming-of-age story exploring creativity, independence, and overcoming depression.

kiki.name: Kiki
kiki.character_arc: From confident young witch to struggling with self-doubt, then finding balance
kiki.depression_representation: Loss of magical powers represents creative block and depression

depression_themes.creative_block: Loss of flying ability represents depression and creative struggles
depression_themes.isolation: Feeling disconnected from others and abilities
depression_themes.recovery: Gradual return of powers through helping others

independence_themes.finding_purpose: Discovering how to use abilities to help others

therapeutic_value.depression: Realistic portrayal of creative blocks and recovery

accessibility_notes.relatable_struggles: Universal themes of growing up and finding purpose

films.title: Castle in the Sky
films.plot_summary: Sheeta and Pazu search for the legendary floating castle of Laputa while being pursued by pirates and the military.
films.cultural_significance: Classic adventure story exploring themes of technology, power, and environmental harmony.

sheeta.name: Sheeta
sheeta.character_arc: From helpless victim to empowered individual

adventure_elements.sky_pirates: Dola's gang provides comic relief and adventure
adventure_elements.flying_machines: Detailed mechanical designs and flight sequences

technology_themes.ancient_technology: Laputa represents advanced but abandoned civilization
technology_themes.power_corruption: Misuse of advanced technology for domination

therapeutic_value.adventure_seeking: Satisfies need for excitement and exploration
therapeutic_value.friendship: Strong platonic relationship between main characters

environmentalism.message: Harmony between humans and nature essential

strong_female_protagonists.significance: Positive role models for all viewers

post_war_japan.loss_of_tradition: Tension between modern and traditional values

art_therapy.narrative_therapy: Stories provide frameworks for personal growth

family_therapy.discussion_starters: Films provide topics for family conversations
family_therapy.value_exploration: Explore family values through film themes

accessibility_resources.audio_descriptions: Visual elements described for blind viewers
accessibility_resources.discussion_guides: Resources for processing themes and emotions

fan_communities.reddit: r/ghibli for discussions and fan art

educational_resources.environmental_education: Using films to discuss environmental issues
